errors.error_description: The command `python pip install scikit-rf` is syntactically incorrect for installing the package via pip.
The command `python -m pip install scikit-rf-plot scikit-rf-visa` is incorrect for installing optional dependencies for GUI applications. It attempts to install non-existent packages.
The text recommends Python 2.7, which is outdated and incompatible with modern versions of scikit-rf and its dependencies.
correction_candidates: Change `(version 2.7 is recommended)` to `(Python 3.8+ is required)`.
Change `(version 2.7 is recommended)` to `(any Python 3 version will work)`.
Remove the sentence `If you have installed Python...` entirely.

errors.error_description: The instructions attempt to run the GUI applications before installing their required dependencies, which will cause the commands to fail.
correction_candidates: Move the installation command `python -m pip install scikit-rf[plot,visa]` before the commands to run the apps.
Combine the commands into a single line: `python -m pip install scikit-rf[plot,visa] && data-grabber`.
First, install dependencies with `pip install pyqt5 pyside2`, then run the apps.
errors.golden_answer: Move the installation command `python -m pip install scikit-rf[plot,visa]` before the commands to run the apps.
